results.title: Mr. Rossi goes camping
results.creator_credit: Bruno Bozzetto and Bruno Bozzetto Films
results.brief_description: Mr Rossi’s search for a peaceful camping site leads him into hilarious encounters with bulldozers, cows and mountain-climbing motorcycles. Though not a “message” film, along with the laughter the real ecological problems come through. An animated film.

results.title: Mr. Robot
results.brief_description: A young programmer, Elliot, suffers from a debilitating anti-social disorder and finds himself in the intersection between the cybersecurity firm he works for and the underworld organisations bringing down corporate America.

constellations_other.name: Hack the planet
constellations_other.description: How do you represent something that's... kinda boring to look at, like hacking, when you're operating in a visual medium like film, TV and videogames?

constellations_other.name: Fight for your right
constellations_other.description: Real world revolution and the fictional representations that reflect the struggle for equality in the past, present and dystopian future.

constellations_other.name: The power of alternate endings
constellations_other.description: This Constellation about alternate perspectives, dream states, sitcoms and spin-offs was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

constellations_other.name: Freedom from surveillance
constellations_other.description: Real world and cinematic authoritarianism and resistance explored through documentaries, Hollywood blockbusters, TV and videogames.

results.description: A contemporary and culturally resonant drama about a young programmer, Elliot, who suffers from a debilitating anti-social disorder and decides that he can only connect to people by hacking them. He wields his skills as a weapon to protect the people that he cares about. Elliot will find himself in the intersection between a cybersecurity firm he works for and the underworld organizations that are recruiting him to bring down corporate America.
description_for_label: A contemporary and culturally resonant drama about a young programmer, Elliot, who suffers from a debilitating anti-social disorder and decides that he can only connect to people by hacking them. He wields his skills as a weapon to protect the people that he cares about. Elliot will find himself in the intersection between a cybersecurity firm he works for and the underworld organizations that are recruiting him to bring down corporate America.

results.title: Mr. Neal Is Entitled to Be an Agitator
results.creator_credit: Daryl Dellora, Sue Maslin and Film Art Doco Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: This film takes its title from the judgement handed down by Lionel Murphy in favour of a Queensland Aboriginal activist. Judge Lionel Murphy (1922-1986), noted for legal reforms such as the Family Law Act and Trade Practices Act, was the most senior judicial figure in the modern history of the Commonwealth to be charged with a criminal offence. The film examines the events surrounding this controversial case with Murphy battling to retain his position on the High Court during the last years of his life. In a wider sense, the film considers some of the more fundamental issues about Australian law, the role of the police and security and surveillance in Australia.

results.title: Mr. Hulot's holiday = M. Hulot's holiday [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jacques Tati, Fred Orain, Discana and Cady
results.brief_description: In the pipe-smoking daydreamer Mr. Hulot, Jaques Tati created one of the most adored and one of the funniest of screen clowns. In a sleepy seaside resort town, Hulot is the centre of increasing chaos: deckchairs behave anarchically, a summer Ball turns into a disaster. Amidst it all Mr. Hulot wanders around oblivious to the madness. “Mr. Hulot’s Holiday” is a beautifully orchestrated piece of comic cinema and widely considered Tati’s funniest film. Also available on VHS [303607].

results.title: Mr. Holland's opus
results.creator_credit: Stephen Herek, Robert W. Cort, Michael Nolin, Ted Field, PolyGram Film International and Interscope communications
results.brief_description: Richard Dreyfuss plays Glen Holland, a musician who falls into a temporary teaching position at J.F. Kennedy High and stays for 30 years. The opus he composes takes second place to his great work, that of enriching the lives of his students as they pass through his class. This is not a film about a hero who performs brave deeds; but of ordinary people in everyday settings who strive daily for excellence in their lives. Dreyfuss is ably supported by Glenne Headly, Jay Thomas and Olympia Dukakis. “Mr Holland’s opus” is a sentimental, warm film which will uplift the spirit.

results.title: Mr. Happy [and friends]
results.brief_description: Seven fun-filled stories about Mr. Happy and six of his friends - Mr. Funny, the funniest man you will ever see; Mr. Lazy who lives in Sleepyland; Mr. Chatterbox who never gives you a moment of silence; Mr. Grumpy who is the grumpiest person you will ever meet; Mr. Worrier the biggest worrier in the world and Mr. Silly who wants to win the silliest idea of the year competition. Based on the popular “Mr. Men” picture books by Roger Hargreaves. Narrated by Arthur Lowe of “Dad’s Army” fame.

results.title: Mr. Halpern and Mr. Johnson
results.creator_credit: Alvin Rakoff, Ely Landau, Edie Landau, Primetime Television and HTV
results.brief_description: This made for television theatre production stars two highly acclaimed actors, one British the other American, in what is a most thought provoking and intriguing piece of drama about two men and their shared love of one woman over a period of 40 years. Laurence Olivier is Joe Halpern, the husband, and Jackie Gleason plays Ernest Johnson, the man who is in love with Halpern’s wife. Written by Lionel Goldstein.

results.title: Mr. Fish and Lotis
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
This video features the character’s Mr. Fish (the security guard) and Lotis (a lift) in a combination of songs and stories. Lotis is no ordinary lift - she can travel with children to any place and any time. Mr. Fish is in a glass booth that makes him look like he is in an enormous fish bowl surrounded by a bank of TV monitors.

results.title: Mr. Deeds goes to town
results.brief_description: One of the most successful comedies, this is the story of Longfellow Deeds (Gary Cooper), an unassuming, tuba-playing young country hick who inherits his uncle’s $20 million estate. He is catapulted from small-town peace to New York turmoil. Discovering he’s been duped by crooked big city associates and the beautiful girl reporter (Jean Arthur) whom he loves, Deeds decides to give away his fortune to the needy. His lawyer interprets this as a sign of insanity and a bitter courtroom battle ensues with Deeds refusing to testify. Only love can save the day. This timeless “little-man-against-the-world” comedy-drama won Capra the 1936 Academy Award for Best Director and received five Oscar nominations, including Best Picture and Best Actor.
